009package imagingbook.common.util;
010
011import java.io.ByteArrayInputStream;
012import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
013import java.io.IOException;
014import java.io.ObjectInputStream;
015import java.io.ObjectOutputStream;
016import java.lang.reflect.Field;
017import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
018import java.util.ArrayList;
019import java.util.Base64;
020import java.util.List;
021
022/**
023 * Defines static methods for object copying and encoding to strings.
024 * 
025 * @author WB
026 * @version 2022/09/11
027 */
028public abstract class ObjectUtils {
029        
030        private ObjectUtils() {
031        }
032        
033        // https://stackoverflow.com/a/26000025
034        
035        /**
036         * Returns a shallow copy of the given object using reflection.
037         * This can be used if the {@link Cloneable} interface is not 
038         * (or cannot be) implemented.
039         * 
040         * @param <T> generic type
041         * @param entity the object to be copied
042         * @return the object copy
043         */
044        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
045        public static <T> T copy(T entity) {
046            Class<?> clazz = entity.getClass();
047//          T newEntity = (T) entity.getClass().newInstance();
048            T newEntity = null;
049                try {
050                        newEntity = (T) entity.getClass().getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
051                } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException | InvocationTargetException
052                                | NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e) { }
053
054            while (clazz != null) {
055                copyFields(entity, newEntity, clazz);
056                clazz = clazz.getSuperclass();
057            }
058
059            return newEntity;
060        }
061
062        private static <T> T copyFields(T entity, T newEntity, Class<?> clazz) {
063            List<Field> fields = new ArrayList<>();
064            for (Field field : clazz.getDeclaredFields()) {
065                fields.add(field);
066            }
067            for (Field field : fields) {
068                field.setAccessible(true);
069                try {
070                                field.set(newEntity, field.get(entity));
071                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) { }
072            }
073            return newEntity;
074        }
075        
076        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
077        
078        // adapted from https://stackoverflow.com/a/30968827
079        private static byte[] convertToBytes(Object object) {
080                ByteArrayOutputStream bos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
081            try (ObjectOutputStream out = new ObjectOutputStream(bos)) {
082                out.writeObject(object);
083                return bos.toByteArray();
084            } catch (IOException e) { }
085            return null;
086        }
087        
088        private static Object convertFromBytes(byte[] bytes) {
089                ByteArrayInputStream bis = new ByteArrayInputStream(bytes);
090            try (ObjectInputStream in = new ObjectInputStream(bis)) {
091                return in.readObject();
092            } catch (IOException | ClassNotFoundException e) { }
093            return null;
094        }
095        
096        
097        // TODO: check for null/exceptions
098        /**
099         * Serializes and encodes an arbitrary object to a string. This is potentially
100         * dangerous and only intended for local use, e.g., to define constant matrices
101         * with full precision. The string encoding is 'Base64' implemented with
102         * standard Java8 functionality. See {@link #decodeFromString(String)} for
103         * decoding.
104         * 
105         * @param object an arbitrary object
106         * @return the Base64 string encoding of the object
107         */
108        public static String encodeToString(Object object) {
109                byte[] ba = convertToBytes(object);
110                return Base64.getEncoder().encodeToString(ba);
111        }
112        
113        // TODO: check for null/exceptions
114        /**
115         * Decodes and deserializes an object encoded with {@link #encodeToString(Object)}.
116         * The type of the encoded object must be known.
117         * 
118         * @param string the encoded object string
119         * @return the associated object (cast to the known type)
120         */
121        public static Object decodeFromString(String string) {
122                byte[] ba = Base64.getDecoder().decode(string);
123                return convertFromBytes(ba);
124        }
125
126}
